info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 11:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM MDT... At 1144 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Pep, or 28 miles south of Portales, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Milnesand, Lingo, and Pep. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for southeastern and east central New Mexico.
